This module defines the types used in midi files. Check http://www.music.mcgill.ca/~ich/classes/mumt306/StandardMIDIfileformat.html for a detailed format of a midi file.

Types

Ticks = uint32
Unit of time for the events in a MIDI file 
TimeSignature = tuple[n: uint8, d: uint8, clocks: uint8, n32Notes: uint8]
Time signature where n is the nominator, d the denominator written as the log_2 of the real denominator signature (hence, only powers of two are possible). clocks expresses the number of MIDI clocks in a metronome click. n32Notes expresses the number of 32nd-notes in a MIDI quarter note (24 MIDI clocks) 
Scale = enum
  Major, Minor
KeySignature = tuple[k: int8, scale: Scale]
Key signature, where -k is the number of flats, if k<0. If k>0, k expresses the number of sharps. For k=0 we are in the key of C. 
Note = uint8
A MIDI note, ranging from C-1 to G9 
Channel = uint8
Port = uint8
MidiStatus = enum
  NoteOff = 0x00000080, NoteOn = 0x00000090, NoteAfterTouch = 0x000000A0,
  CtrlChange = 0x000000B0, PgmChange = 0x000000C0, ChannelAfterTouch = 0x000000D0,
  PitchBend = 0x000000E0
MetaEvent {...}{.pure.} = enum
  SeqNum = 0x00000000, Text = 0x00000001, Copyright = 0x00000002, TrackName = 0x00000003,
  InstrumentName = 0x00000004, Lyrics = 0x00000005, Marker = 0x00000006,
  CuePoint = 0x00000007, ChannelPrefix = 0x00000020, MidiPort = 0x00000021,
  EndOfTrack = 0x0000002F, SetTempo = 0x00000051, SMPTEOffset = 0x00000054,
  TimeSignature = 0x00000058, KeySignature = 0x00000059, SeqSpecific = 0x0000007F
Format = enum
  SingleTrack,                ## the file contains a single multi-channel track
  MultipleTracks,             ## the file contains one or more simultaneous tracks of a sequence 
  MultipleSongs               ## the file contains one or more sequentially independent single-track patterns
Organisation of the MIDI file. 
MThdChunk = object
  format*: Format
  num_tracks*: uint16          ## Number of tracks in the MIDI file
  division*: uint16 ## Meaning of delta-times. 
                  ## If the MSB is 0, then bit 14..0 represent the number of delta time ticks make up a quarter note.
                  ## For instance, if division is 96, then a time interval of an eighth-note between two events in the file would be 48.
                  ## If the MSB is 1, then delta times in a file correspond to subdivisions of a second, in a way consistent with SMPTE and MIDI Time Code.
                  ## See the MIDI specs for more information.
MIDI header chunk representation 
EventType {...}{.pure.} = enum
  MidiEvent, SysexEvent, MetaEvent
Event = object
  delta_time*: Ticks           ## Time passed since the last event
  abs_time*: Ticks ## Ticks passed since the beginning of the file (i.e. 0).
                 ## This is calculated while reading the file. It is never used by this library, but for
                 ## textual representation.
  case etype*: EventType
  of MidiEvent:
      mi_status*: MidiStatus
      mi_channel*: Channel
      mi_par1*: uint8
      mi_par2*: uint8

  of SysexEvent:
      se_c*: uint8
      se_bytes*: seq[uint8]

  of EventType.MetaEvent:
      me_type*: MetaEvent
      me_bytes*: seq[uint8]
A MIDI event 
MTrkChunk = object
  events*: seq[Event]          ## All the events pertaining to the track
Track chunk 
MidiFile = object
  header*: MThdChunk
  tracks*: seq[MTrkChunk]

Funcs

func hasSharps(ks: KeySignature): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
func hasFlats(ks: KeySignature): bool {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
func keySigName(ks: KeySignature): string {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Gives a textual representation of the key signature 
func transpose(n: Note; t: int): Note {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Transposes a note by t semi-notes 
func toOctave0(n: Note): Note {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Converts note n to the range 0..11, mapping it to octave 0 
func octave(n: Note): uint8 {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns the octave belonging to note n 
func noteName(n: Note; ks: KeySignature = defaultKeySignature; withOctave: bool = true): string {...}{.
    raises: [], tags: [].}
Returns a full textual representation (i.e. note name and octave) of note n, taking the key signature ks into account 
func midiNameToNote(n: string): Note {...}{.raises: [KeyError], tags: [].}
Parses a textual representation of note n to a MIDI note. If the octave is not specified, octave 5 is used http://www.richardbrice.net/midi_notes.htm

Examples:

assert midiNameToNote("C0") == 0
assert midiNameToNote("A1") == 21
assert midiNameToNote("C5") == 60
assert midiNameToNote("C") == 60
assert midiNameToNote("C9") == 108
assert midiNameToNote("G10") == 127

func calculateDuration(m: MidiFile): float {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
